metadata.title: CVE-2024-56575 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:media: imx-jpeg: Ensure power suppliers be suspended before detach themThe power suppliers are always requested to suspend asynchronously,dev_pm_domain_detach() requires the caller to ensure propersynchronization of this function with power management callbacks.otherwise the detach may led to kernel panic, like below:[ 1457.107934] Unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference at virtualaddress 0000000000000040[ 1457.116777] Mem abort info:[ 1457.119589]   ESR = 0x0000000096000004[ 1457.123358]   EC = 0x25: DABT (current EL), IL = 32 bits[ 1457.128692]   SET = 0, FnV = 0[ 1457.131764]   EA = 0, S1PTW = 0[ 1457.134920]   FSC = 0x04: level 0 translation fault[ 1457.139812] Data abort info:[ 1457.142707]   ISV = 0, ISS = 0x00000004, ISS2 = 0x00000000[ 1457.148196]   CM = 0, WnR = 0, TnD = 0, TagAccess = 0[ 1457.153256]   GCS = 0, Overlay = 0, DirtyBit = 0, Xs = 0[ 1457.158563] user pgtable: 4k pages, 48-bit VAs, pgdp=00000001138b6000[ 1457.165000] [0000000000000040] pgd=0000000000000000,p4d=0000000000000000[ 1457.171792] Internal error: Oops: 0000000096000004 [#1] PREEMPT SMP[ 1457.178045] Modules linked in: v4l2_jpeg wave6_vpu_ctrl(-) [lastunloaded: mxc_jpeg_encdec][ 1457.186383] CPU: 0 PID: 51938 Comm: kworker/0:3 Not tainted6.6.36-gd23d64eea511 #66[ 1457.194112] Hardware name: NXP i.MX95 19X19 board (DT)[ 1457.199236] Workqueue: pm pm_runtime_work[ 1457.203247] pstate: 60400009 (nZCv daif +PAN -UAO -TCO -DIT -SSBSBTYPE=--)[ 1457.210188] pc : genpd_runtime_suspend+0x20/0x290[ 1457.214886] lr : __rpm_callback+0x48/0x1d8[ 1457.218968] sp : ffff80008250bc50[ 1457.222270] x29: ffff80008250bc50 x28: 0000000000000000 x27:0000000000000000[ 1457.229394] x26: 0000000000000000 x25: 0000000000000008 x24:00000000000f4240[ 1457.236518] x23: 0000000000000000 x22: ffff00008590f0e4 x21:0000000000000008[ 1457.243642] x20: ffff80008099c434 x19: ffff00008590f000 x18:ffffffffffffffff[ 1457.250766] x17: 5300326563697665 x16: 645f676e696c6f6f x15:63343a6d726f6674[ 1457.257890] x14: 0000000000000004 x13: 00000000000003a4 x12:0000000000000002[ 1457.265014] x11: 0000000000000000 x10: 0000000000000a60 x9 :ffff80008250bbb0[ 1457.272138] x8 : ffff000092937200 x7 : ffff0003fdf6af80 x6 :0000000000000000[ 1457.279262] x5 : 00000000410fd050 x4 : 0000000000200000 x3 :0000000000000000[ 1457.286386] x2 : 0000000000000000 x1 : 0000000000000000 x0 :ffff00008590f000[ 1457.293510] Call trace:[ 1457.295946]  genpd_runtime_suspend+0x20/0x290[ 1457.300296]  __rpm_callback+0x48/0x1d8[ 1457.304038]  rpm_callback+0x6c/0x78[ 1457.307515]  rpm_suspend+0x10c/0x570[ 1457.311077]  pm_runtime_work+0xc4/0xc8[ 1457.314813]  process_one_work+0x138/0x248[ 1457.318816]  worker_thread+0x320/0x438[ 1457.322552]  kthread+0x110/0x114[ 1457.325767]  ret_from_fork+0x10/0x20

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-56575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1

linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1015.15').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
